title: Remove the romantic vs friendship onboarding question (keep onboarding intent flow simplified)

requirements.text: Remove the onboarding step that asks the user to choose between romantic vs friendship (the “Looking for?” step) from the multi-step profile setup dialog, so new users are no longer prompted with that question during onboarding.

quotes: remove the romantic vs friendship question entirely

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/components/profile/ProfileSetupDialog.tsx`, the onboarding flow no longer includes an intent step that presents options Friendship/Romantic/Both.
acceptanceCriteria for onboarding navigation: users can proceed through onboarding without ever seeing a romantic/friendship choice, and the flow still reaches the share-code step successfully.
No onboarding validation errors mention selecting an intent when the user has not been asked for one.

requirements.text: Ensure profile creation still sends valid backend-required fields even after removing the romantic vs friendship onboarding step by applying a safe default relationship intent value for newly created profiles.

quotes: Reduce the number of questions (maybe just ask intent, not romantic vs friendship).
remove the romantic vs friendship question entirely

acceptanceCriteria: When completing onboarding in `ProfileSetupDialog`, the mutation payload still includes `relationshipIntent` and `preferences.intent` fields required by the backend `UserProfile` type.
For newly created profiles, `relationshipIntent` and `preferences.intent` are set automatically (without user input) to a single consistent default value.
On successful onboarding, the backend accepts the saved profile (no traps/errors due to missing intent fields).

requirements.text: Update the Profile page UI so the removed romantic vs friendship question is not shown as a profile field (neither in view mode nor edit mode), while keeping profile updates functional.

quotes: remove the romantic vs friendship question entirely

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx`, the “Looking For” section (Friendship/Romantic/Both) is no longer displayed anywhere in the profile screen.
Editing and saving the profile still works without requiring the user to select Friendship/Romantic/Both.
Profile updates continue to send a valid `relationshipIntent` value to the backend (e.g., preserved from the existing stored profile value).

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI component sources must be composed, not edited).
Do not modify immutable frontend hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Respect the existing backend `UserProfile` type shape (relationshipIntent remains a required field in the payload).
nonGoals: Do not add new onboarding questions or new matching/dating features.
Do not change backend schema/types for `RelationshipIntent`, `UserProfile`, or `UpdateUserProfile` as part of this request.
Do not redesign the overall onboarding UI beyond removing the specified question and maintaining a working flow.
